entities.name: diary
entities.description: The diary is a mysterious object that Harry and Dumbledore discuss. It is mentioned as being given to Ginny by Lucius Malfoy.

entities.name: lucius malfoy
entities.description: Lucius Malfoy is a person who gave the diary to Ginny. He is described as having white hands and is accused of giving out Lord Voldemort's old school things.

entities.name: dobby
entities.description: Dobby is a house-elf who is present in the scene. He is punished by twisting his ears when Harry nods at him.

entities.name: harry potter
entities.description: Harry Potter is a person who understands something and nods at Dobby. He accuses Lucius Malfoy of giving the diary to Ginny.

entities.name: ginny weasley
entities.description: Ginny Weasley is a person who got hold of the diary. She is mentioned as being given the diary by Lucius Malfoy.

entities.name: dumbledore
entities.description: Dumbledore is a person who smiles at Harry and advises Lucius Malfoy not to give out Lord Voldemort's old school things.

entities.name: lord voldemort
entities.description: Lord Voldemort is mentioned as the owner of the diary. He is also referred to in relation to his old school things.

entities.name: arthur weasley
entities.description: Arthur Weasley is a person who will make sure that Lord Voldemort's old school things are traced back to Lucius Malfoy if they find their way into innocent hands.

relationships.description: Lucius Malfoy gave the diary to Ginny, as accused by Harry.
Harry nodded at Dobby, which caused Dobby to twist his ears in punishment.
Lucius Malfoy is accused of giving out Lord Voldemort's old school things.
